enWisdom: The loss that causes illness (or burns [the heart]) is the loss of loved ones
A stranger is one who does not have a [close] friend
Losing a loved one leads to forlornness
The loss of one’s brothers weakens one’s fortitude

Wisdom: مَنْ لَا إِخَاءَ لَهُ لَا خَيْرَ فِيهِ
enWisdom: One who has no brother (or brotherhood) has no goodness in him

Wisdom: مَنْ لَا إِخْوَانَ لَهُ لَا أَهْلَ لَهُ
enWisdom: One who fraternizes for the sake of this world is deprived [of it]

Wisdom: مَنْ لَا صَدِيقَ لَهُ لَا ذُخْرَ لَهُ
enWisdom: One who points out your faults to you and defends you in your absence, then he is your true friend, so protect him

Wisdom: مَنْ فَقَدَ أَخاً فِي اللَّهِ فَكَأَنَّمَا فَقَدَ أَشْرَفَ أَعْضَائِهِ
enWisdom: One who [always] argues with his brothers has few friends
It is from weak personal judgment to break ties with one’s brothers
Do not break off ties with a friend, even if he is ungrateful
Never take your friend’s enemy as your friend, thereby making an enemy out of your friend
